issue.title: Inotify triggers "invalid subpath" error

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body: By giving subdirs ending in slash, which is no longer accepted. We should accept that again.

body: The logs have not been modified, correct?

I can confirm this (#3804).

Here's my log:
```
Dec 20 21:41:39 blockbox syncthing-inotify[1230]: [WARNING] http://0.0.0.0:8384/rest/db/scan?folder=sSo6k-yeVTq&next=3600&sub=
Dec 20 21:41:39 blockbox syncthing-inotify[1230]: [WARNING] Error: Status 500 != 200 for POST: sSo6k-yeVTq, invalid subpath
Dec 20 21:41:39 blockbox syncthing-inotify[1230]: [WARNING] Syncthing failed to index changes for  sSo6k-yeVTq Invalid HTTP status code
```
@AudriusButkevicius I removed the time/host/process marker prefix but otherwise I have not modified them and the lines are in-order with no lines removed

An existing but empty `sub` is an invalid sub path. I don't think that #3805 caused it, but that this has the same root cause as what #3805 fixed (much stricter sub path check).

Either syncthing-inotify should remove the `sub` parameter, if it's empty, or syncthing needs another fix to ignore `sub`, if it's empty.

issue.title: Don't send syncthing the "subs" param when syncing entire folder

repository.name: syncthing-inotify
repository.description: File watcher intended for use with Syncthing (Linux, BSD, Windows, OSX)

issue.body:
This should resolve syncthing/syncthing#3829

Starting with 0.14.14, syncthing has more strict checking of passed sub values, one of the contraints being not accepting an empty value. This can occur when `syncthing-inotify` aggregates a large volume of changes into a "complete folder sync" notification.

body: I have submitted a pull request for syncthing-inotify (syncthing/syncthing-inotify#144) to (hopefully) resolve this issue from that end. Though given that syncthing has already made an exception for trailing slashes, I wonder if it would not still be appropriate to handle an empty subs list gracefully.
I'll fix and release this tomorrow some time. Thank you @javmorin for getting the logs to show what was actually going on.

@calmh yeah it's because syncthing-inotify just iterates and adds each of the passed subs via url.Values.Add(). In the case of a complete folder sync, the subs list is just [""] which results in "&sub=" as the query parameter
Thanks for the quick fix, it seems to work fine now!
